head.title: James Murphy and Ms. Hahn Marry

hedline.hl1: James Murphy and Ms. Hahn Marry

block.p: Alexandra Marie Hahn, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Herbert R. Hahn of New York, was married last evening to James Timmerman Murphy, the son of Mr. and Mrs. William M. Murphy of West Rockport, Me. Rabbi Charles Lippman performed the ceremony at the Harvard Club in New York.

Ms. Hahn, who is 31 years old and is keeping her name, is a vice president of Bankers Trust in New York. She graduated from Wellesley College. Her father is the director of communications for the United States Council for International Business in New York. Her mother, Ethelee Hahn, is chairwoman of the foreign language department at the Convent of the Sacred Heart in New York.

Alexandra Marie Hahn, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Herbert R. Hahn of New York, was married last evening to James Timmerman Murphy, the son of Mr. and Mrs. William M. Murphy of West Rockport, Me. Rabbi Charles Lippman performed the ceremony at the Harvard Club in New York.

Ms. Hahn, who is 31 years old and is keeping her name, is a vice president of Bankers Trust in New York. She graduated from Wellesley College. Her father is the director of communications for the United States Council for International Business in New York. Her mother, Ethelee Hahn, is chairwoman of the foreign language department at the Convent of the Sacred Heart in New York.

Mr. Murphy, 32, is a vice president of finance at D & B Software in New York. He graduated from Colgate University and received an M.B.A. degree from New York University. His father, who is retired, was the vice president of employee relations at the Wagner Electric Company in Parsippany, N.J.
